GoodMeal: ^I'm called to the kitchen for my farewell meal.
^I walk in seeing everyone chatting and having a good time.
^Trissa is chatting up the other two ruclusive first-floor residents at the center table.

b: ^I see Charlotte, over in her usual chair, relaxing of all things.
^I see Charlotte assisting in the preparations of the farewell meal.
^Eduardo and Isaac are in their usual corner, giggling.
^Eduardo and Isaac are surprisingly not sitting nearby each other, but on near opposite ends of the room.

GoodMeal: ^Timothy is sitting eagerly by the side of the center table, just one seat over from where he was earlier this week.
^[Max] "We've got your throne all ready, sire."
^Timothy has been very giddy all day today. Its nice.
^[Max] "You get all cozy now. I'll grab you some food! Be right back!"
GoodEnd: ^[Max] "Sorry that took so long! Timothy was just asking if he-"

c: ^I let the slip up Max made slide. Obviously Timothy wants it to be a secret.

g-0: ^"Thanks, for getting my food, by the way."
^. It's your special occasion. We should be the ones thanking you!"
^Max stands fully straight up, letting the full volume of their voice boom over the chatter.
^"Ladies, gentlemen, and everyone in between, may I have your attention?"
^The cafeteria's ambient babble slowly subsides into silence. Max looks over an index card before shoving it in their pocket.
^[Max] "Today we say farewell to one of our more established residents,
^, who is finally ready to go back out into the real world!"
^"And while normally one of us RAs gives these toasts, a new resident has asked if he can speak and well... I just couldn't say no."
^An extremely shaky Timothy rises from his seat and shuffles over to Max.
^[Dyed>Timothy] "<jitter>Uh, h-hi everyone. I'm, um, Timothy Miyuri.</jitter>"
^"<jitter>You, uh, all p-probably remember me fr-from the meal last Monday. Heh...</jitter>"
^Timothy is clearly super nervous with everyone's attention up on him. So why did he want to get up and speak?
^"<jitter>N-now I w-was r-really n-nervous c-coming here.</jitter>"
^"<jitter>A-afraid o-of having to deal with everything. Afraid of p-people's expectations of me and stuff.</jitter>"
^"<jitter>B-but I've m-met people here who helped me be a little less afraid of everything.</jitter>"
^"<jitter> A-and the person who I think has helped me the m-most was my roommate,</jitter><delay=0.25>
^. Thank you so much for being my friend."
^"This toast is to you. May your life on the outside be as warm as you've made ours here in Sunflower House."
^Timothy raises his cup. Max quickly follows suit, flashing me a beaming grin.
^I glance across the room as cups slowly start to rise.
^Charlotte daintily lifts her cup with a flowing, deliberate wrist motion.
^Trissa raises her glass with a cheerful whoop.
^Eduardo's cup rockets vigorously into the air, sending some of its contents splashing onto his head.
^Isaac cracks a smile and lifts his cup cautiously, accompanied by a nod of approval.
^All the residents of Sunflower House are raising their cups for me.
^I've been on the other end of this so many times, I didn't think I would find it so overwhelming...
^I start laughing, in shock of everything around me.
^] "Thanks, everyone! I... don't know what to say. Except thanks."
^I've never done well under a spotlight, but I get the sense that no one expects me to.
^I take my seat and everyone starts digging into their food.
^The rest of the evening goes without incident, and it's really put me in a good mood.
^As things wind down, I make my way back out into the House.

BadMeal: ^I'm called to the kitchen for my farewell meal.
^I walk in seeing everyone chatting and having a good time.
^Trissa is chatting up Jesse and John at the center table.

b: ^I see Charlotte, over in her usual chair, relaxing of all things.
^I see Charlotte assisting in the preparations of the farewell meal.
^Eduardo and Isaac are in their usual corner, giggling.
^Eduardo and Isaac are surprisingly not sitting nearby each other, but on near opposite ends of the room.

BadMeal: ^[Max] "We've got your throne all ready, sire."
^They're doing a good job of disguising it, but you can tell Max is only pretending to be happy.
^I take my seat at the center table, remembering how, less than a week ago, Timothy had done the same.
BadEnd: ^[Max] "Sorry that took so long! Turns out the cook wasn't really ready yet."
^[Max] "Thanks for being so cool about... well, everything."
^"Timothy might not have had the chance to thank you today, but I know he appreciated what you did for him."
^"Ladies, gentlemen, and everyone in between, may I have your attention?"
^The cafeteria's ambient babble slowly subsides into silence. Max looks over an index card before shoving it in their pocket.
^"It's been a rough week for many of us, I know."

^"Today we said goodbye to our newest resident, Timothy Miyuri, who I have received word is safe and comfortable at Blackwell. It wasn't what we all hoped for, but I'm sure we'll see him again when he's ready."
^"But today we also say farewell to one of our more established residents,
^, who is finally ready to go back out into the real world!"
^"This toast is to both of you. May you find happiness and good fortune as you face the challenges ahead."
^Max raises their cup and the room follows suit. A small applause follows the toast and the murmur of conversation returns.
^Despite everything, it does feel nice to be appreciated and Max's words are a small comfort.
^A few more residents come up to say goodbye, but they're not really people I knew that well.
^I hang out eating and chatting for a while.
^Today has really tired me out. I end up leaving the cafeteria early.

BrokeUpBad: ^Eduardo is the first to come up.
^"With your chill, I'm sure you'll do great out there."
^Eduardo just sort of shuffles around, not sure what else to say.

c: ^, amigo. Just at the bottom today. Usually I've got Isaac to help around this time, but..."
^. I said some things I really shouldn't have and now I don't know where we even stand any more."
^"I kind of blew up at him the other day."
^"But this isn't your problem, eh? You've got the whole world waiting for you. Come back and visit, okay?."
^I decide he's probably just in his depressive state and needs some time to himself.

g-0: ^Eduardo shrugs, then turns to leave. The week didn't seem to go well for him...

StayingSad: ^Next to approach is Charlotte, who seems to have taken a break from her duties.

b: ^Uh oh. She looks pissed. What did I-
^<Speed=200%>Oh god, I forgot to meet her for tea!
^"It is quite rude to accept an invitation and then fail to keep the appointment, you know."
^"And to think I was so impressed with your progress..."
^] "I'm so sorry, Charlotte! It just slipped my mind... I..."
^"I made a grave mistake. I didn't mean to hurt you..."
^"Would you accept an honest apology from a forgetful idiot?"
^[Charlotte] "Perhaps you are not as entirely bereft of courtesy as I had surmised."
^"I would extend a new invitation, only... it seems you wouldn't be around to take advantage of it."
^Uh oh. She looks pissed. What did I-
^<Speed=200%>Oh god, I forgot to meet her in the library!
^"It is quite rude to accept an invitation and then fail to keep the appointment, you know."
^[Charlotte] "But I recognize you are no expert at these sorts of things."
^"Ironically, had you not been absent for our meeting I would have passed that information along to you."
^"I suppose you will have to do your best to learn `on the fly`, then."

StayingSad: ^[Charlotte] "How are you finding your last day? Pleasant, I hope!"

c: ^To be honest, I'm not really okay after earlier. But I figure it'd be kinder to put on a good face.
^[Charlotte] "Well, that's not quite the enthusiasm I have come to expect from outgoing residents."
^"Perhaps I am simply too used to Trissa's unwavering excitement. She's leaving two weeks from now and it seems to be her favorite subject of conversation."
^Charlotte seems to be carrying on without any concern for Timothy's absence.
^] "You're kidding, right? Did you not hear about Timothy?"
^[Charlotte] "Ah, you refer to the events of earlier today involving Mr. Miyuri."
^"These things happen from time to time. The hospital is the best place for him, I'm sure."

g-0: ^[Charlotte] "I should return to my post, now. The line is starting to grow to an uncomfortable size. We'll speak later, I'm sure."
^I watch Charlotte stride gracefully toward the serving line as Max emerges with a steaming plate of food.

c: ^] "So, Charlotte, what do you think of Timothy's new look?"

^"I trust he has you to thank for both."

^"Oh, dear! What if he asks me?!"
^"I know precious little about exotic hair care solutions..."

^"So many things to be done before I can rejoin society..."
^"My studies continue to be fruitful. Perhaps soon I should be able to..."

LeavingHappy: ^[Charlotte] "Congratulations on completing your tenure at the Sunflower House,
^[Charlotte] "I have put a great deal of thought into what you said earlier."

c: ^[Charlotte] "And... I have not quite reached a conclusion just yet."
^"I am realizing a lot of things I thought I knew are wrong. It's difficult for someone like me, but..."
^[Charlotte] "Yes. I've even mentioned a few things to Trissa to get a second opinion."

g-0: ^"I wanted to bring it up in case I come to a decision before you leave."
^"I feel you should know how I am doing, after demonstrating so much concern for me."
^"You've done great good here for the residents... And for me. You've done far more than was expected of you."
^"You have my deepest and sincerest gratitude for that."
^[Charlotte] "Please, there is no need for modesty. This evening is dedicated in your honor, after all."
^"It would be rude to keep you from your meal any longer. We will speak later, I'm sure."
^Charlotte bows out of the conversation, before heading to her seat. Max and Timothy emerge just behind her, holding steaming plates of food.
